question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: new()] [Resource Exhaustion] Can an attacker trigger thread pool creation with an extremely large num_threads parameter (e.g., u64::MAX or billions), causing memory exhaustion and system crash during ThreadPoolBuilder initialization? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: new()] [Panic/Unwrap] The .unwrap() on line 34 can panic if thread pool creation fails - can an attacker exploit resource constraints or platform-specific thread limits to trigger this panic and halt the global executor, causing loss of liveness? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: new()] [Integer Overflow] When calculating num_threads + 2 on line 32, can integer overflow occur if num_threads is close to usize::MAX, leading to unexpected thread pool sizes or panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: new()] [Resource Leak] If multiple GlobalExecutor instances are created without proper cleanup, can the cumulative thread pools exhaust system resources and cause validator node failure? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: new()] [Thread Starvation] The hardcoded addition of 2 extra threads (line 30-31 comment) assumes one for cross-shard receiver and one for waiting - if actual usage differs, can thread starvation occur causing deadlocks in global transaction execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Empty Transaction Bypass] The early return on line 52 for empty transactions returns Ok(vec![]) - can an attacker exploit empty transaction blocks to bypass critical state validation or consensus checks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [State View Lifetime] The state_view reference is passed to execute_transactions_with_dependencies - can race conditions occur if the state_view is modified concurrently by other shards during global execution, leading to non-deterministic transaction outputs? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Cross-Shard Race Condition] The global_cross_shard_client is cloned and passed to ShardedExecutorService - can messages from other shards arrive in incorrect order or after execution completes, causing state inconsistencies? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [GLOBAL_ROUND_ID Manipulation] GLOBAL_ROUND_ID is passed as a constant on line 60 - can an attacker exploit the special global round semantics to bypass round-based isolation and access data from other rounds? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Config Override] The BlockExecutorConfig is constructed with default local config on line 62-66 - can an attacker manipulate onchain_config to override critical safety parameters and bypass gas limits or execution constraints? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Dependency Cycle] The TransactionWithDependencies vector on line 46 may contain circular dependencies - does the execution logic detect and reject cycles, or can attackers create infinite loops causing validator hang? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Dependency Validation] Are cross-shard dependencies in TransactionWithDependencies validated before execution? Can an attacker reference non-existent shards or rounds to cause execution failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Missing Dependency] If a transaction depends on data from a shard that hasn't completed execution, does the global executor properly wait or does it proceed with stale/missing data causing state divergence? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Dependency Ordering] The transaction order in the input vector determines execution order - can an attacker manipulate transaction ordering to violate dependency constraints and cause non-deterministic execution across validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Thread Pool Reuse] The executor_thread_pool is cloned on line 56 - can concurrent calls to execute_global_txns() on the same GlobalExecutor instance cause thread pool exhaustion or scheduling issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: new()] [Concurrency Mismatch] The concurrency_level field is stored but may differ from actual thread pool size (num_threads + 2) - can this mismatch cause incorrect parallelism assumptions in downstream execution logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Struct: GlobalExecutor] [Arc Safety] Multiple Arc clones of executor_thread_pool and global_cross_shard_client are created - can data races occur if internal state is mutated without proper synchronization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: get_executor_thread_pool()] [Thread Pool Leakage] The thread pool is cloned and returned on line 72 - can external callers spawn arbitrary work on this pool, interfering with global transaction execution and causing performance degradation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Blocking Call] The call to execute_transactions_with_dependencies may block - can an attacker submit transactions that cause indefinite blocking (e.g., waiting for cross-shard messages that never arrive), halting the validator? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Error Propagation] VMStatus errors are propagated directly from ShardedExecutorService - can malicious transactions trigger specific VMStatus errors that are misinterpreted by callers, leading to incorrect state commits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Partial Execution] If execute_transactions_with_dependencies returns an error midway through execution, are partial transaction outputs discarded? Can this lead to state inconsistencies if some validators apply partial results? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Error Masking] Does VMStatus error handling distinguish between benign execution failures and critical system errors? Can attackers trigger critical errors that get treated as normal transaction failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Cross-Shard Spoofing] The global_cross_shard_client receives messages from other shards - are these messages authenticated? Can a malicious shard send forged messages to corrupt global transaction execution? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Message Ordering] Cross-shard messages may arrive out of order - does the global executor enforce strict ordering? Can out-of-order messages cause transactions to see inconsistent state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-vm/src/sharded_block_executor/global_executor.rs] [Function: execute_global_txns()] [Message Replay] Can cross-shard messages be replayed from previous blocks or rounds to manipulate global transaction execution? (High)
